page.title: 10Boughton's Carnival
page.content: Due to Boughton's position on the busy A2 road, the village was never able to get together for any real major annual event. After much petitioning and protesting Boughton finally got a much needed by-pass in May 1976. Since that date, the people of the village have taken the opportunity to celebrate this freedom of The Street by holding a carnival along the once busy road. It takes the form of a procession from the bottom of Boughton Hill to the village hall and playing fields at the opposite end of the village,where a party continues through the afternoon.People dress up in fancy- dress,march as majorettes,play music in a band or go on a float.In the field they play games, eat food and go on rides and side-shows.
